intro: Canthium umbelligerum var. oliganthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Due to its toxic sap, it requires caution when handling.
